TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WorkflowViewElement extends System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl implements class System.Activities.Presentation.ICompositeViewEvents

Docs.summary: Specifies the base class for any UI element that appears on the Windows Workflow Foundation designer canvas and that visually represents an instance of an atomic item that can be edited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Examples of items represented by a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement> include <xref:System.Activities.Activity> and <xref:System.Activities.Statements.FlowNode>. `WorkflowViewElement` provides a common contract that the designer uses to render the visual element onto the designer surface and to interact with it through the various editing actions.
If you are building a designer for an <xref:System.Activities.Activity>, you should use the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.ActivityDesigner> base type. If there are non-activity elements that need to be treated as first class items on the designer canvas, such as a toolbox item that needs to be draggable throughout the canvas, or for cut-and-paste scenarios, use `WorkflowViewElement` as the base class. If you do not want to use the standard activity chrome for an activity designer, `WorkflowViewElement` should be used as the base type to provide the most flexibility.
A <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement> represents a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem> in the UI and provides code access to the model item and an <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext> that allows changes to be made.
## Examples For a code sample showing how to create a new <xref:System.Activities.Activity> and an <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.ActivityDesigner>, and then how to associate them, see the sample in the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.ActivityDesigner> documentation.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.Collapsible%2A> property is set to `false` by default.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the element can be collapsed.
Docs.value: if the element can be collapsed; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the list of all composite views.
Docs.value: The list of all composite views.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the editing context that is shared by all elements contained in a workflow designer.
Docs.value: The object for the workflow designer that contains the workflow view element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext> object is a collection of services shared between all elements contained in the designer and used to interact between the host and the designer. Services are published and requested through the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext>.

Docs.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets the name of a property of the model item associated with the element that is used as automation ID.
Docs.returns: The name to use as automation ID. The base class always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Implement this method in your derived class to add your own handling that specifies a property of a model item to be used to identify the model item to automation.

Docs.value: A object that is a wrapper around a model instance or an in-memory representation of the underlying workflow.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem> object provides notification of changes even if the model instance does not provide change notification.
